details.title: Here are the key candidates
details.content:
BJP:

Raman Singh (CM contesting from Rajnandgaon) Ram Dayal (Turncoat, joined BJP at the last minute, contesting from Pali Tankhar)

Congress:

TS Singh Deo (Leader of Opposition, contesting from Ambikapur) Karuna Shukla (Former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's niece, pitted by the Congress against Raman Singh)

JCC:

 Ajit Jogi (Former CM contesting from Marwahi constituency) Renu Jogi (Ajit Jogi's wife, contesting from Kota) BSP Richa Jogi (Ajit Jogi's daughter-in-law from Akaltara)

details.title: Early trends from Chhattisgarh
details.content: Congress and BJP are leading in two constituencies each.

details.title: BSP-led alliance opens its account
details.content: As per latest trends, ruling BJP is leading in three seats in Chhattisgarh. While Congress and BSP-led alliance leading in two constituencies each.

details.title: Latest scenes from Congress headquarters in New Delhi
details.content:
Firecrackers brought to Congress office in Delhi by party leader Jagdish Sharma as counting is underway for assembly elections in five states pic.twitter.com/vq5dZB2Gta

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Latest trends from Chhattisgarh
details.content: As per latest trends, BJP leading at 19 seats. Congress leads at 14 constituencies. BSP-lead alliance ahead at three seats.

details.title: CM Raman Singh trailing
details.content: Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh trailing at Rajnandgaon constituency. Late PM and BJP stalwart Atal Bihari Vajpayee's niece and Congress Candidate Karuna Shukla leading there.

details.title: First reaction from BJP on Chhattisgarh chances
details.content:
Kailash Vijayvargiya, BJP: We'll definitely form government in Madhya Pradesh & Chhattisgarh. Seeing the early trends coming from Rajasthan, we believe BJP will form a government there as well. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/PUr9gnV4a6

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Close fight between CM Raman Singh and Karuna Vajpayee in Rajnandgaon seat
details.content: Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh leads by 45 votes in Rajnandgaon seat. He was earlier trailing against late PM and BJP stalwart Atal Bihari Vajpayee's niece and Congress Candidate Karuna Shukla.

details.title: Congress takes lead in Chhattisgarh
details.content: Chhattisgarh initial trends: out of 78 seats, Congress leading in 55 seats, followed by BJP (16), BSP alliance leading in seats.

details.title: Another senior state minister trailing
details.content: Senior Chhattisgarh state tribal minister Kedar Kashyap too trailing in Narayanpur seat South Bastar.

details.title: Ajit Jogi is trailing at Marwahi constituency
details.content:
According to official ECI trends, former Chhattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi is at third position at Marwahi. BJP is leading and Congress at second ( file pic) #ChhattisgarhAssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/fhzR0IZIKl

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Congress takes massive lead
details.content: As per latest trends, Congress is now leading in 58 out of 90 seats. Ruling BJP is second with 24. BSP and Ajit Yogi alliiance ahead at six constituencies.

#Visuals of celebration from outside Congress office in Delhi. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/4bWIf5EN8I

details.title: BJP MP from Chhattisgarh reacts on the latest trends
details.content:
Saroj Pandey, BJP national general secretary & MP from Durg (Chhattisgarh): We can't say anything after only 1st round of counting. We hope to form the government in Chhattisgarh. It's a very close fight. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/ZQQt4fyeWR

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Latest trends from Chhattisgarh
details.content: Congress leading on 53 seats, BJP leading on 16 seats, Janata Congress on four seats, and others on two seats in Chhattisgarh.

details.title: Chhattisgarh ministers trailing
details.content: Seven cabinet ministers of Raman Singh government now trailing in Chhattisgarh. The CM is leading in Rajnandgaon seat by only 1600 votes now.

details.title: Ajit Jogi and his wife Renu maintain their respective leads
details.content: Former Chhattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi now leading by 10264 votes in his constituency and his wife Renu too leads by 2479 votes.

details.title: Its Congress in Bastar
details.content: Congress is now leading in all 12 Bastar seats.

details.title: Mamata Banerjee's take on the assembly polls
details.content:
Semifinal proves that BJP is nowhere in all the states. This is a real democratic indication of 2019 final match. Ultimately, people are always the ‘man of the match’ of democracy. My congrats to the winners 3/3

— Mamata Banerjee (@MamataOfficial) December 11, 2018

details.title: Here is constituency-wise scenario in Chhattisgarh
details.content:
Rajesh Munat was behind Congress' Vikas Upadhyay in Raipur City West Assembly seat. 

Amar Agarwal was trailing behind Shailesh Pande of the Congress in Bilaspur segment. 

Brij Mohan Agarwal was behind Congress' Kanhaiyya Agrawal in Raipur city south segment.

Minister Kedarnath Kashyap was closely behind Narayan Kashyap of the Congress in Narayanpur.

Dayal Das Baghel trailing behind Congress' Gurudayal Singh Banjare in Navagarh segment.

Mahesh Gagdha was also trailing behind Congress' Vikram Mandavi in Bijapur segment.

Prem Prakash Pandey was ahead of Congress candidate Devendra Yadav in Bhilainagar seat. 

Lal Rajwade was leading over Ambika Singh Dev of the Congress in Bainkuthpur.

details.title: Happy with poll results: Ajit Jogi
details.content: With trends indicating a win for the Congress in Chhattisgarh, the former CM said on Tuesday that people chose the party because they found it the most viable alternative to the BJP. The Janta Congress Chhattisgarh (J) president told reporters that the people of the state wanted to oust the Raman Singh-led government, which has been in office for 15 years. Jogi, who was in the Congress before he floated his own party, said the assembly results would help his party emerge as a third front in the state.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi reaches Sonia Gandhi's residence
details.content: Congress President Rahul Gandhi reaches Sonia Gandhi's residence at 10 Janpath in New Delhi, as the Grand Old Party is leading in the assembly poll counting of three out of the five states.

details.title: Congress celebrates as they are all set for a clear majority in Chhattisgarh
details.content:
#WATCH: Celebrations outside Congress office in Raipur, Chhattisgarh. Congress is leading on 60 out of 90 seats in the state. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/8Bgf0Wu0Gv

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Madhya Pradesh results come as a shocker: BJP
details.content:
Sanjay Kakade, BJP Rajya Sabha MP: I knew we would lose in Rajasthan & Chhattisgarh but MP trends have come as a surprise. I think we forgot the issue of development that Modi took up in 2014. Ram Mandir, statues & name changing became the focus. #AssemblyElectionResults2018 pic.twitter.com/pHXe4PwhPr

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.content:
Chhattisgarh: #Visuals from Bharatiya Janata Party office in Raipur. BJP is leading on 15 seats while Congress is leading on 61 seats, out of the total 90 seats in the state. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/AxmHnhvqHm

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Latest Trend
Maoists strike at Sukma district
details.content: One CRPF jawan injured in an IED blast in Chintagupha, Sukma. Further details awaited.

details.title: Chhattisgarh Congress president says that party high command will decide the CM-designate
details.content:
Chhattisgarh Congress President Bhupesh Baghel arrives at Congress office in Raipur. He says, “Ppl of Chhattisgarh took the fight in their own hands. We are grateful to Rahul Gandhi, we fought for the ppl. We got more seats than expected, high command will decide who will be CM” pic.twitter.com/i5B8Js0gXR

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Newly-elected Chhattisgarh Congress MLAs will meet in Raipur tomorrow
details.content: Newly elected Congress MLAs of Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan will meet in Raipur and Jaipur respectively tomorrow.

details.content:

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) December 11, 2018

details.title: Status report on the Sukma blast
details.content: The  CRPF jawan who was injured in an IED blast in Chintagupha, Sukma has been evacuated by a chopper for Raipur. More details awaited.

details.title: Congress makes massive inroads in Central Chhattisgarh
details.content: There are 67 seats in central Chhattisgarh, of which Congress is leading in 42 seats, a gain of 28 seats compared to the 2013 polls.

details.title: Raman Singh tenders his resignation
details.content: I have tendered my resignation to the Governor: Outgoing Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh.

details.title: Analysis of the Chhattisgarh Election Results so far
details.content:
#ResultsWithTNIE | TNIE Chhattisgarh correspondent Ejaz Kaiser analyses the #ChhattisgarhElections2018 results. #AssemblyElections2018
LIVE report: https://t.co/8HrLHNqeBy pic.twitter.com/ZEtkMeAh5l

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) December 11, 2018

details.title: Accept public mandate: Chhattisgarh Congress
details.content: We humbly accept the mandate by the people. They have not given us the right, they have given us a responsibility. They believed the promises we made in our manifesto. People trusted the words of Rahul Gandhi ji&gave us an agenda, we accept it: Congress leader PL Punia.

details.title: Congratulate Congress for their poll success: Outgoing CM Raman Singh
details.content:
Raman Singh, outgoing CM of #Chhattisgarh: We respect the mandate that the public has given. I congratulate Congress on this success. I consider it my luck to serve the public of Chhattisgarh for the last 15 years. #AssemblyElectionResults2018 pic.twitter.com/LPFjO9wgoD

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
Chhattisgarh Governor Anandiben Patel accepts resignation of Raman Singh
